verses.text: God arises, His enemies scatter; those who hate Him flee before Him.
verses.comment: The imagery of God arising connects to military victory and God's power to save, a theme reflecting Christ's ultimate victory over sin and death. See the typology in Num. 10:35.

verses.text: As smoke is blown away, You blow them away; as wax melts before fire, the wicked perish before God.
verses.comment: The destruction of the wicked is compared to fleeting, impermanent things, showing the power and holiness of God's judgment.

verses.text: But the righteous are glad; they rejoice before God and delight with joy.
verses.comment: The joy of the righteous is a result of God’s presence, prefiguring the joy of the redeemed in Christ.

verses.text: Sing to God, sing praises to His name; raise up a song to Him who rides upon the clouds—His name is the LORD—rejoice before Him.
verses.comment: "Who rides upon the clouds" signifies divine majesty and power, often applied in the New Testament to Christ’s ascension (Acts 1:9).

verses.text: Father of the fatherless and protector of widows is God in His holy dwelling.
verses.comment: God’s care for the vulnerable foreshadows Christ’s compassion shown in the Gospels. The mention of “holy dwelling” hints toward the importance of sanctified places of worship.

verses.text: God sets the solitary into families; He leads prisoners out with singing, but the rebellious dwell in a parched land.
verses.comment: God’s restorative and unifying work points toward the unity of believers in Christ. The spiritual sense implies God rearranging lives into harmony.

verses.text: O God, when You went out before Your people, when You marched through the wilderness—Selah—
verses.comment: Refers to God’s guidance of Israel in the Exodus, instructive for understanding the journey of faith and formation of God's people.

verses.text: the earth shook, the heavens poured down rain before God—the One of Sinai—before God, the God of Israel.
verses.comment: The imagery of trembling creation points to God’s overwhelming holiness, with Sinai as the locus for revelation—anticipating later events such as Pentecost.

verses.text: You sent abundant rain, O God; You restored Your weary inheritance.
verses.comment: Rain here symbolizes spiritual blessing and renewal, echoed in prophetic language about God’s blessings to His people (Isa. 44:3).

verses.text: Your people settled there; in Your goodness, You provided for the poor, O God.
verses.comment: God cares for the needy, foreshadowing Christ’s ministry, and reflecting the ongoing mission to serve the poor.

verses.text: The Lord gives the word; the women who announce the news are a great host:
verses.comment: The prominence of women proclaiming God’s works anticipates the women at the Resurrection (Matt. 28:1-8).

verses.text: ‘Kings and armies flee, they flee!’ and she who stays at home divides the spoil.
verses.comment: The reversal of fortune and division of spoils echoes Christ’s triumph over sin, redistributing spiritual blessings.

verses.text: Though you lie among the sheepfolds, the wings of a dove are covered with silver, its feathers with shining gold.
verses.comment: The dove is a sign of peace and the Spirit. The imagery of silver and gold foreshadows purity and richness of grace.

verses.text: When the Almighty scattered kings there, it was like snow falling on Zalmon.
verses.comment: Divine intervention leads to sudden reversals, reinforcing that God’s power subdues kings and nations.

verses.text: Mount Bashan is a majestic mountain; high, rugged mountain is Mount Bashan.
verses.comment: Reference to Bashan—famous for height and grandeur—contrasts God's chosen place, showing that spiritual significance outweighs physical grandeur.

verses.text: Why do you, high mountains, look with envy at the mountain God chose for His dwelling, where the LORD will dwell forever?
verses.comment: God’s chosen dwelling points to Jerusalem’s spiritual significance. A hint of the lasting presence God establishes with His people.

verses.text: The chariots of God are tens of thousands, thousands upon thousands; the Lord is among them; Sinai is now in the sanctuary.
verses.comment: God’s power and glory described as angelic hosts. The idea of ‘sanctuary’ deepens spiritual and liturgical significance.

verses.text: You ascended on high, leading captives in Your train, and received gifts among men, even among the rebellious, that the LORD God may dwell there.
verses.comment: Paul applies this verse to Christ’s ascension (Eph. 4:8), marking the fulfillment through Christ gathering all people to Himself and imparting gifts to the Church.

verses.text: Blessed be the Lord, who daily bears us up; God is our salvation. Selah.
verses.comment: God’s daily fidelity resonates with the Christian call to rely on God’s saving work. The physical and spiritual senses unite in this blessing.

verses.text: Our God is a God of salvation; to the LORD God belong escapes from death.
verses.comment: Reference to salvation and escape from death connects to Christ’s resurrection and victory over death.

verses.text: But God will strike the heads of His enemies, the hairy crown of him who goes on in his guilt.
verses.comment: God’s victory over enemies foreshadows Messianic judgment and Christ’s defeat of spiritual foes.

verses.text: The Lord said, ‘I will bring them back from Bashan; I will bring them back from the depths of the sea,’
verses.comment: Redemption even from extremity prefigures the resurrection from the grave and restoration.

verses.text: that your foot may wade in blood, the tongues of your dogs have their share from the enemies.
verses.comment: Bloody victory language reflects total defeat of evil, also symbolizing spiritual victory over sin.

verses.text: Your procession has been seen, O God, the procession of my God, my King, into the sanctuary.
verses.comment: The liturgical procession to the sanctuary underlies the importance of solemn worship and the visible unity of God's people.

verses.text: The singers go before, the musicians follow after; among them young women playing tambourines.
verses.comment: Joyful, ordered worship is depicted, illustrating the harmonious participation of the whole community.

verses.text: Bless God in the great congregation, the LORD, O you who are from the fountain of Israel.
verses.comment: Blessing God as a gathered assembly evokes the spiritual sense of corporate worship and continuity of faith.

verses.text: There is Benjamin, the youngest, leading them, the princes of Judah in their company, the princes of Zebulun, the princes of Naphtali.
verses.comment: The gathering of the tribes symbolizes the unity of God’s people—a theme fulfilled in the spiritual unity of the Church.

verses.text: Summon Your strength, O God; show Your power, O God, as You have done for us before.
verses.comment: The prayer calls for the continuity of God's intervention, a theme found in the outpouring of the Spirit.

verses.text: Because of Your temple at Jerusalem kings will bring You gifts.
verses.comment: The international homage paid at the temple foreshadows the universal recognition of God’s kingship in Christ.

verses.text: Rebuke the wild beasts among the reeds, the herd of bulls with the calves of the peoples; trample down those who crave silver. Scatter the nations who delight in war.
verses.comment: The wild beasts symbolize enemies of God's order. God’s power brings peace and justice, linked with Messianic reign.

verses.text: Nobles shall come from Egypt; Cush shall hasten to stretch out hands to God.
verses.comment: Gentile nations’ worship evokes the global reach of Christ’s redemption and unity among all peoples.

verses.text: O kingdoms of the earth, sing to God; sing praises to the Lord—Selah—
verses.comment: The universal invitation prefigures every nation worshiping God, fulfilled in the gospel proclamation.

verses.text: to Him who rides in the heavens, the ancient heavens; He utters His voice, a mighty voice.
verses.comment: Divine sovereignty demonstrated by God’s voice echoes the creative Word praised in John 1:1.

verses.text: Ascribe strength to God; His majesty is over Israel, and His power is in the heavens.
verses.comment: God’s majesty unites heaven and earth, anticipated as well in Christ’s ascension and ongoing intercession.

verses.text: Awesome is God in His sanctuary; the God of Israel gives power and strength to His people. Blessed be God!
verses.comment: The sanctuary is the locus of God's power and blessing, encouraging reverent worship and recognition of His authority. Unity and strength in worship point to the spiritual vitality of God's people throughout history.
